alert.note: Alert for Southern Denali Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 26 at 5:56AM AKST until January 28 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 PM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero. North winds gusting to 40 mph. Blowing snow with reduced visibility. * WHERE...Southern Denali Borough. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 3 PM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds will increase today with winds gusting to 40 mph tonight through Sunday. Wind chills will drop to 55 below this afternoon and continue into Sunday. Blowing snow with reduced visibility will develop tonight.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
